item.title: tikz-network
item.description: Check out my tool to visualize complex networks in LaTeX

item.title: pathpy
item.description: I am the lead developer of pathpy, an OpenSource python package for the analysis of time series data on networks using higher-order and multi-order graphical models.

item.title: research
item.description: My research interests lie in developing and quantifying a robust understanding of urban resilience with a focus on complex interdependent infrastructure systems.

item.title: About me
item.description: Short bio Dr. Jürgen Hackl is a senior researcher at the Data Analytics Group of the University of Zurich. His research interests lie in urban resilience and span both computational modeling and network science. Much of his work has been on improving the understanding, design, and performance of complex interdependent infrastructure systems, affected by natural hazards. In the networking area, he has worked on characterizing multi-layer spatially embedded random network using concepts from spatial statistics and graph theory.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Refereed Journal Publications Hackl, J., and Adey, B. T. (2019) Estimation of traffic flow changes using networks in networks approaches. Applied Network Science, 4(1), 28. doi: 10.1007/s41109-019-0139-y Hackl, J., and Dubernet T. (2019). Epidemic Spreading in Urban Areas using Agent-Based Transportation Models. Future Internet, 11(4), 92. doi: 10.3390/fi11040092 Hackl, J., and Adey, B. T. (2019). Modelling multi-layer spatially embedded random networks. Journal of Complex Networks, 7(2), 254–280.
